name: Ref docs - AS1428.4.1 Fig 2.1, Fig 3.1 RDN 06-05
Acceptance criteria - Tactile indicators shall conform to the requirements of AS1428.4.1.
○ Tactiles shall be chosen from the DTP approved list per RDN 06-05
○ Tactiles shall be approved by council representative where (if applicable).
Freq - Prior to start of works
Acceptance criteria - Luminance-contrast testing shall be completed as per AS 1428.4.1 to confirm the selected TGSIs have a luminance-contrast to the base surface of not less than 30%
Freq - Prior to start of works
Remarks/record (eg. Test frequency reports, certificates, checklist etc) -
Acceptance criteria - TGSI’s shall be inspected prior to fixing to confirm the below tolerances are met:
– TGSI’s shall be inspected prior to fixing to confirm the below tolerances are met:
– TGSI base is a maximum 3mm above the ground surface.
– Within 300mm of traffic signal push-buttons (where applicable).
Acceptance criteria - Tactiles shall be installed:
– To the full width of the path of travel
– So that there is no likelihood of the edges lifting
– In accordance with AS1428.4.1 and the IFC drawings
Acceptance criteria - Tactiles shall be installed:
– Parallel to the required direction of travel
– Along the centreline of the required direction of travel
– So that there is no likelihood of the edges lifting
– In accordance with AS1428.4.1 and the IFC drawings
Acceptance criteria - All Product Non-Conformance(s) recorded and closed (if applicable)
3.2 - Quality Representative to check the above criteria and records to confirm
Acceptance criteria - All above criteria met, and records identified attached.
